title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.6.36 | 01-12-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: All this will be conducive for your personal satisfaction also.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces verse 36 from the 6th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, explaining that Narada is responding to Vyasa Deva's questions about self-realization and the cause of his dissatisfaction.

segments.key_quote: What is the cause for his dissatisfaction? That's clearly answered by Narada.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Vyasa Deva's dissatisfaction despite compiling Vedic literature and how Narada Muni instructed him to compile Srimad Bhagavatam, which exclusively glorifies Krishna.

segments.key_quote: That is the topmost perfection of bhakti.
segments.summary: The speaker shares Prabhupada's summary of Narada's instructions, outlining the process of devotional activities from initial faith (Shraddha) to Krishna Prema, the love of God.

segments.key_quote: The boy became enlightened in their association by hearing them after he partook remnants of uh prasadam left behind by them so it had a very big transformation of his heart the small boy
segments.summary: The speaker explains how Narada's devotional service began in his previous life as the son of a maidservant through association with sages and partaking of their remnants (prasadam), leading to purification and attraction to Krishna katha.

segments.key_quote: We have to re-establish our lost relationship with Krishna that is the whole practice of bhakti
segments.summary: The speaker describes Narada's search for the Lord, the brief darshan he received, and how devotional service helps one get rid of the reactions of fruitive activities, breaking the cycle of birth and death.

segments.key_quote: The material body gets spiritualized in contact with devotional service
segments.summary: The speaker explains how devotional service transforms the material body into a spiritual body, enabling one to enter the spiritual realm of the Lord.

segments.key_quote: All the mysteries of transcendental realization are duly experienced by Narada Muni himself and therefore by hearing such an authority one can have some idea of the results of devotional life
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that by following in the footsteps of Narada, one can purify their heart and transform their body, and that these results of devotional life are hardly delineated even in the original texts of the Vedas.

segments.key_quote: Srimad Bhagavatam is the mature fruit of all Vedic tree of literature and nothing is directly explained in the original Vedas or the Upanishads but everything is directly explained in the Srimad Bhagavatam.
segments.summary: The speaker explains why the results of devotional life are not directly explained in the Vedas and Upanishads, highlighting that Srimad Bhagavatam is the mature fruit of Vedic literature and the most important text, especially in the age of Kali.
